contentrichtext.text: {{Expand French|date=December 2009|Gennes (Maine-et-Loire)}} {{Infobox French commune |name = Gennes |image = RueRépubliqueGennes.jpg |caption = |region = [[Pays de la Loire]] |department = [[Maine-et-Loire]] |arrondissement = [[Arrondissement of Saumur|Saumur]] |canton = [[Canton of Gennes|Gennes]] |INSEE = 49149 |postal code = 49350 |mayor = Jean-Yves Fulneau |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = [[Communauté de communes de Gennes]] <small>[[Pays Loire, Layon, Lys, Aubance]]</small> |longitude =-0.2317 |latitude =47.3417 |elevation m =29 |elevation min m =22 |elevation max m =98 |area km2 =32.52 |population = 1952 |population date = 2006<ref>[http://www.insee.fr/fr/ppp/bases-de-donnees/recensement/populations-legales/departement.asp?dep=49 populations légales 2006 sur le site de l’INSEE]</ref> |demonym = Gennois, Gennoise |website = }} [[File:Blason ville fr Gennes (Maine-et-Loire).svg|thumb|50px|Shield]] '''Gennes''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Maine-et-Loire]] [[Departments of France|department]] in western [[France]]. ==History== Gennes was the scene of a [[Battle of Saumur (1940)|World War II battle]] in June 1940, during the last stages of the [[Battle of France]]. The French casualties, seventeen Cadets of the ''Cadre noir'' Saumur Cavalry school,<ref>''Musée de la Cavalerie française'' in Saumur (French site): http://87.237.184.32/page/affichelieu.php?idLieu=6191&idLang=fr</ref> killed between 17 and 20 June 1940, are buried in the enclosure of the 11th century Saint-Eusèbe church built over an ancient Gallo-Roman sanctuary, on a hilltop overlooking the scene of their sacrifice. [[File:Dolmen de la Madeleine - Gennes - 20061125.jpg|thumb|Dolmen of La Madeleine, one of the dolmens visible around Gennes]] The castle of [[Milly-le-Meugon]], in its vicinity, was the property of the Maillé-Brézé family, closely related to the French royal family through the [[Prince du Sang|First Prince of the Blood]], [[Louis II de Bourbon, Prince de Condé|Louis de Bourbon, Prince of Condé]]. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Maine-et-Loire department]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * http://www.tourisme.fr/office-de-tourisme/gennes.htm (in French) {{Commons category|Gennes (Maine-et-Loire)|Gennes, Maine-et-Loire}} {{Maine-et-Loire communes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gennes, Maine-Et-Loire}} [[Category:Communes of Maine-et-Loire]] {{MaineLoire-geo-stub}}
